definitions: To interrupt someone who is speaking.
To move suddenly in front of another vehicle, often dangerously.
To join a dance or game, often by taking someone else's partner or place.
To activate or begin to operate (of a machine or system).
To include someone in a share of profits or benefits.
examples: She kept cutting in while I was trying to tell my story.
A car suddenly cut in front of us on the highway.
He tried to cut in on their dance.
The air conditioning will cut in when the temperature reaches 75 degrees.
They decided to cut him in on the deal.
